target_audience.primary_persona: Casual puzzle enthusiasts who enjoy NYT Pips domino puzzles and want an efficient way to solve or get hints for challenging puzzles
secondary_personas: Competitive puzzle solvers seeking to verify their solutions
NYT Games subscribers who play daily puzzles
Mobile-first users who prefer solving puzzles on their phones
pain_points: Manually entering puzzle data is tedious and error-prone
No easy way to import puzzles directly from screenshots
Difficult to track and manage solved vs unsolved puzzles offline
Getting stuck on hard puzzles with no way to get progressive hints
Verifying if a partial solution is still valid requires mental computation
goals: Quickly import puzzles via camera/screenshot without manual data entry
Get intelligent hints when stuck without revealing the full solution
Solve puzzles offline while commuting or traveling
Validate their manual solutions against the solver
Build a personal library of puzzles to revisit
target_audience.usage_context: Users typically play during commutes, breaks, or leisure time on mobile devices. They want quick puzzle import via camera, offline capability for areas with poor connectivity, and graduated hints that respect the puzzle-solving experience without spoiling it entirely.

product_vision.one_liner: An offline-first mobile app that imports, validates, and solves NYT Pips domino puzzles using AI-powered image extraction and constraint satisfaction algorithms.
product_vision.problem_statement: NYT Pips players struggle to get help when stuck on puzzles, manually entering puzzle data into digital tools is cumbersome, and there's no elegant mobile solution for storing, solving, and validating domino puzzles offline.
product_vision.value_proposition: Pips combines computer vision for instant puzzle import from photos, a sophisticated CSP solver that runs entirely on-device, and AI-powered graduated hints that help users progress without spoiling the puzzle - all working offline.
success_metrics: Solver success rate across different puzzle difficulties
Time from photo capture to imported puzzle ready for solving
User retention and return rate for daily puzzle solving
Hint usage patterns showing users complete puzzles with help
